name: Saiaz Getaria Hotel

reviews.text: Don't miss staying at Saiaz Getaria if you are in the San Sebastian area, and be sure to ask for a room with a sea view. We are here in the off-season during an unusually dramatic stormy period and we have been watching the dark rain clouds moving in and the waves breaking just below our window.
reviews.title: Tasteful mixture of old and new

likes.liked: — charming mix of old and new

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel, open for just over a year, has been carefully restored from the ruins of several small 15th century castles in the old town of Getaria. You would very rarely find this balance of old and new so tastefully done--it has all the modern conveniences well integrated into the distinct remnants of the old structure.
reviews.title: Beautiful small hotel

likes.liked: — Beautiful restored to detail. Location! Very helpful staff.
likes.disliked: — Ask for parking place in advance

reviews.text: A lift and several meandering wooden staircases take you to your room and to the common living areas overlooking the sea. The rooms are all different and very comfortable and charming with antique furniture, tile and wood floors, excellent beds, modern bathrooms and high speed internet access.
reviews.title: Superb Little Hotel With Excellent & Friendly Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely small hotel in a village about 20 minutes drive from San Sebastian. We booked a double room (36) with a seaview. The rooms are large and have a sweeping view of the beach. We paid 94 Euro for the room which is excellent value.You can leave the window open and hear the pounding of the surf.
reviews.title: Loved the view

likes.liked: — The view and size and comfort of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The village is charming with some quite good restaurants and two nice beaches, but not much else. The staff speak very good English and are very helpful. The biggest problem with the hotel is that it is on a small narrow road that is a dead end. To drop off your luggage is challenging and then you have to turn your car around.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in Gateria at the recommendation of friends instead of San Sebastian. The drive to San Sebastian was difficult due to road works. If you want to spend most of your time in San Sebastian, I recommend you stay in San Sebastian. However, the hotel itself is a special treat.
reviews.title: Wish we could have stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a very enjoyable three night stay at this hotel. Our room was superb, very modern - looking over one of the beaches. It was great to fall asleep to the lapping of the waves! Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and breakfast was of a good standard. Getaria is a good base to explore the local area.
reviews.title: Warm welcome to lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, our stay here was only for one night. The hotel is a little hard to find but well worth seeking out. We didn't have an opportunity to explore the area but the little we did get to see has us promising a return visit.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hidden Hotel

likes.liked: — Views, design of hotel, rooms and staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this accommodation in Getaria so we could be close to San Sebastian but also experience the lifestyle of this small fishing village. Our stay was perfect as the first afternoon we relaxed with a glass of wine (reasonable hotel room service) and enjoyed the magnificent view from full length windows in our modern furnished spacious rooms. The hotel has been beautifully restored/renovated. The breakfast was also very good (my wife really enjoyed the goats cheese and honey on toast). We had a car so it was a pleasant drive to San Sebastian to walk around this lovely town and enjoy by far the tastiest and most imaginative tapas in Spain. We ate both our dinners at reasonable restaurants in Getaria where they all cook the traditional slow smoked whole fish as a specialty. The staff were so helpful and accomodating. There was lovely lounge to sit in and enjoy the scenery and you were able to order tea, coffee or wine any time of day. Hotel Saiaz was the perfect place for us to enjoy this area of Spain and is set in one of the tiny streets of the old town.
reviews.title: Great stay at Saiaz Hotel, Getaria

likes.liked: — The family run service, decor, renovations, views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed a couple of nights in the Junior Suite with great views out to sea. The weather was pretty bad and it was wonderful to gaze out to sea and watch the storms come in. The hotel is in an elevated position right at the edge of this old medieval Basque fishing village. It is beautifully decorated and very comfortable. The hotel offers free wifi and breakfast each morning is good fresh local ingredients. Getaria is a lovely place to spend a couple of nights with some great walks and some excellent restaurants. Situated about an hour from Bilbao and 20 mins by car from San Sebastian. The hotel doesn't offer parking, but this is easily available near-by. Only complaint is that the Junior Suite was clearly two mattresses, which was not ideal as it was a bit lumpy in the middle! Otherwise, a great hotel and both hotel and Getaria highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great View, Authentic Basque Fishing Village

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must first warn you that this hotel is IMPOSSIBLE to find. After driving around aimlessly for a half-hour, and spending another half-hour asking locals in your best broken Spanish where it is (by this time, you doubt the hotel exists at all), you see the Saiaz Getaria -- a beautiful, stone-front structure, pictures of which simply do not do it justice. The staff is laid-back, but friendly. The furnishings are minimal, but tasteful. The rooms are large, well-appointed and charming. (We did not stay in an ocean-facing room, but ours -- which faced the street -- was also quite nice... no complaints.)
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Impossible to Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For American travelers, you'll be happy to find the air-conditioning works well... this is important, especially in summer... and that the beds are one bed (not two singles pushed together, like in many euro hotels.)
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

likes.liked: — Great room with a stunning view

reviews.text: There is a restaurant and bar on site, but we did not eat there as there is cheaper and better fare in town. Getaria is a lovely little place. Do yourself a favor -- try the local fish, and visit the island/national park by the harbor. You won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: Loved the Saiaz Getaria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at this beautiful property. Strongly suggest that you reserve a superior room with view. That comes with large semi-circular shaped windows overlooking an undeveloped ocean view that is literally outside your window. You can listen to the waves crashing on the shore if that is your preference. The bed is comfortable and the shower is strong.
reviews.title: What a marvelous hotel!

reviews.text: The staff at the hotel couldn't be more supportive. If you email them beforehand, they will make you dinner reservations at even some of the most difficult restaurants to book (Akelare, which we strongly recommend). When we got in a real jam with our laundry, they even did our laundry in this emergency.
reviews.title: Website Nicer than the Hotel Itself

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Getaria itself is wonderful. We spent time sunning on the beach. The hotel will lend you beach towels. The many local restaurants all serve the freshest fish, which you can watch them grill right in front of the restaurant. Suggest that you ask the person cooking the fish which fish is best that day. The prices of the fresh fish are very reasonable. Also check out the bar with the most varied pinchos we've ever seen mid-way down the first street.
reviews.title: We loved it too

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, my stay here was acceptable. It just wasn't exceptional,as I had hoped. This was mostly because my room didn't look anything like what the pictures of the room look like on their website, so you need to be a little cautious there. It is a charming, charming town and property that sits on a quaint little street just 30 minutes or so drive from San Sebastian. Staff was really friendly, helpful and nice and it had a comfortable feel. Just was disappointed with my room, which was very ordinary. Kudos to their web designer, who should get a raise.
reviews.title: The most beautiful little hotel I have ever visited

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unlike other reviewers we had no problems finding the hotel, and we'll try to say how good it is in very few words! Like other reveiwers, we loved sipping wine and watching the sunset from our sea-view room.
reviews.title: Thank you, Mikel

description: Small Hotel set in renovated XVth century stone walls. Located inside the village old town, with best Views to the sea.
